column4: hi guys - just installed xubuntu and it looks like the "pipe key" does not work correctly.  If I run "ls | ls", I get "ls: command not found"
what is the output of:  lsb_release -sc
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1159016/     the command I copied and pasted from you is ok, but when I type it, it works
confirms that my "|"  key is screwed, doesn't it?
what is the output of:  echo $PATH
bkc_ when I copy/paste your "/bin/ls | /bin/ls" it works, but when I type it, it doesn't: bash:  /bin/ls: No such file or directory
what is the output of:  echo $PATH
bkc_ I've run "setxkbmap fr" andnow it works...
could add that as a startup item
bkc_ I used to have to type twice to get the ` character.  Now just once.
search dash for 'start' and you'll find it
